Package evs.metric.metrics

Verification metrics for the ensemble mean and (ensemble-derived) forecast probabilities.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
BootstrapableMetric Identifies a metric that may be bootstrapped, in order to assess its uncertainty when computed from a limited sample of verification pairs.
CategoricalMetric Identifies an ensemble or probabilistic metric that is defined only for discrete events, such as the exceedence or non-exceedence of some threshold.
DecomposableScore Identifies a metric that may be decomposed into constituent parts, such as reliability, resolution and uncertainty.
EnsembleMetric An interface identifying an ensemble verification metric.
SingleValuedMetric An interface identifying a single-valued forecast verification metric.
SkillScore An interface that identifies a skill metric.
ThresholdMetric An interface that denotes a metric with one or more thresholds.
 

Class Summary
BrierScore The Brier score is the mean squared error of a dichotomous forecast event in probability space.
BrierSkillScore The Brier skill score measures skill in terms of the Brier Score (BS) and is given by: 1.0 - (BS of forecast system / BS of reference forecast system).
Correlation Computes the linear association between the forecasts and observations using Pearson's product moment correlation coefficient.
DiagramMetric An abstract base class for a metric that comprises a diagram.
MeanAbsoluteError Computes the mean absolute difference between the forecasts and observations.
MeanCaptureRateDiagram The mean capture rate diagram plots the average probability with which a randomly chosen ensemble member will have a given absolute error.
MeanContRankProbScore The Continuous Ranked Probability Score (CRPS) is the integrated squared difference between the cumulative distributions of the forecasts and the observations, where the cdf of the observations is given by the Heaviside function (pdf is the dirac delta function).
MeanContRankProbSkillScore The Mean CRPS skill score measures skill in terms of the Mean CRPS (MCRPS) and is given by: (MCRPS of forecast system - MCRPS of reference forecast system)/(0 - MCRPS of reference forecast system).
MeanError Computes the mean difference between the forecasts and observations, which is indicative of first-order bias in the forecasts.
MeanErrorOfProbabilityDiagram The mean error of probability diagram plots the difference between the observed climatological probability and the average forecast probability for a given real value of the observed variable and plots the residual as a function of the real value, repeated for a set of real values.
Metric An abstract base class for verification metrics.
ModifiedBoxPlot Constructs a modified box-and-whisker plot with a set of thresholds.
ModifiedBoxPlotPooledByLead Constructs a modified box-and-whisker plot with a set of thresholds.
ModifiedBoxPlotUnpooledByLead Constructs a modified box-and-whisker plot with a set of thresholds.
ModifiedBoxPlotUnpooledByLeadObs Constructs a modified box-and-whisker plot with a set of thresholds.
RankHistogram The rank histogram is similar to the spread-bias diagram where the intervals correspond to the ranked ensemble members.
RawMetric An abstract base class for a metric that shows the raw verification data, rather than computing a score or showing a specific attribute of forecast quality.
RelativeMeanError Computes the mean difference between the forecasts and observations, which is indicative of first-order bias in the forecasts, divided by the mean of the observations.
RelativeOperatingCharacteristic The Relative Operating Characteristic (also known as the Receiver Operating Characteristic) plots the probability of successful detection for an event against the probability of failed detection.
ReliabilityDiagram Constructs a reliability diagram for specified forecast probability thresholds and probability thresholds of the observations given the forecasts.
ROCScore The ROC score comprises the rescaled area under the ROC curve (AUC), which provides a measure of a probability forecasts ability to discriminate between events and non-events according to the observed outcome at different forecast probability levels.
ROCUtilities Utilities class for computing ROC statistics.
RootMeanSquareError The Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) is the square root of the mean squared difference between the single valued forecasts and corresponding observations.
SampleSize Convenience metric that computes the sample sizes available for each forecast lead time, and by threshold, if available.
ScoreMetric An abstract base class for metrics that represents an integrated score.
SingleValuedQQPlot The SingleValuedQQPlot provides a comparison of the order statistics of the observed values and single-valued forecast values, which may be derived from an ensemble forecast using a specified function (e.g.
SpreadBiasDiagram The spread-bias plot shows the fraction of observations falling in a given probability interval on the forecast support, which should be equal to the width of that interval (in the case of perfect reliability).
ThresholdMetricStore A store of threshold metrics, such as reliability diagrams or ROC plots.
 

Exception Summary
MetricCalculationException Class for throwing exceptions that signify an error calculating a metric.
 

Package evs.metric.metrics Description

Verification metrics for the ensemble mean and (ensemble-derived) forecast probabilities.
